intro: Erophila rhomboidea f. abbreviata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved erophila, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
